content.question: The function <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> is given by <math alttext="f open parentheses x close parentheses equals 2 plus log subscript 2 x"><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>log</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mi>x</mi></math>, and the function <math alttext="g"><mi>g</mi></math> is given by <math alttext="g open parentheses x close parentheses equals 2 to the power of open parentheses x minus 2 close parentheses end exponent"><mi>g</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><msup><mn>2</mn><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfenced></msup></math>. Which of the following statements provides correct reasoning for why functions <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> and <math alttext="g"><mi>g</mi></math> are inverse functions of each other?

choices.label: Because both functions have the same domain and the same range

Because <math alttext="2 plus log subscript 2 open parentheses 2 to the power of open parentheses x minus 2 close parentheses end exponent close parentheses equals x"><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>log</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mfenced><msup><mn>2</mn><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfenced></msup></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mi>x</mi></math> and <math alttext="2 to the power of open parentheses open parentheses 2 plus log subscript 2 x close parentheses minus 2 close parentheses end exponent equals x"><msup><mn>2</mn><mfenced><mrow><mfenced><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>log</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfenced><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfenced></msup><mo>=</mo><mi>x</mi></math>

Because <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> involves a logarithmic function with base <math alttext="2"><mn>2</mn></math>, and <math alttext="g"><mi>g</mi></math> involves an exponential function with base <math alttext="2"><mn>2</mn></math>

Because the reflection of the graph of <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> over the <math alttext="y"><mi>y</mi></math>-axis produces the graph of <math alttext="g"><mi>g</mi></math>, and the reflection of the graph of <math alttext="g"><mi>g</mi></math> over the <math alttext="y"><mi>y</mi></math>-axis produces the graph of <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math>
